sentences.en: Feint feint, preventing your target from attacking for 2 seconds.
sentences.cn: 佯攻, 2秒内防止目标受到攻击.

sentences.en: He made a feint of studying hard, though actually he was listening to the radio.
sentences.cn: 他假装在用功, 其实在听收音机.

sentences.en: He made a feint of working hard.
I feinted to the left, then to the right.
sentences.cn: 我佯装要攻到左方，然后再到右方。

sentences.en: I think it is a feint.
Make a feint to the east but attack in the west.
Market wave can be predicted and explained by study the feint of and deference of supply - demand.
sentences.cn: 信息不完全导致的供需不平衡是造成市场波动的根本原因,对供需差和需求假象的分析可以解释和预测市场波动的程度.

sentences.en: Mr Williams made a feint of accidentally knocking the table with a decanter.
sentences.cn: 威廉先生假装不小心用酒瓶碰着了桌子.

sentences.en: No.10 is striking a feint Ball.
The boy made a feint of studying hard, but actually he was listening to the radio.
sentences.cn: 这男孩装作用功, 但实际上他正听著收音机.

sentences.en: The boy made a feint of studying hard, though actually he was listening to the radio.
sentences.cn: 这孩子实际上正在听收音机, 却假装着在用功.

sentences.en: The contest becomes mainly one of feint and counterfeint.
sentences.cn: 这场比赛变成了一场以佯攻与反佯攻为主的较量.

sentences.en: The sunset provision was just a feint to make them look affordable.
sentences.cn: 日落条款只是虚晃一枪,目的是让这些举措看起来负担得起.

sentences.en: There may be raised after feint shot to start to adjust, they may fall down directly.
sentences.cn: 有可能虚晃一枪拉高之后展开调整, 也有可能直接向下回落.

sentences.en: We adopted the strategy of making a feint to the east but attacking in the west.
sentences.cn: 我们采取声东击西的战术.

sentences.en: With lightning feint, one after another pair finally seized hold and began to grapple.
sentences.cn: 一对对摔跤手采取声东击西的佯攻手法,使对方猝不及防,终于揪住了对方,开始搏斗起来.

trans.tran_en: a movement or an attack that is intended to deceive an opponent, especially in  boxing
to pretend to hit someone in  boxing
